711149f-a.text:
303-301 West 12th Street (north side of Abingdon Square), between Eighth Avenue and Hudson Street, the Jeffersonian Club, Regular Democratic Organization, Third Assembly District South.
March 8, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

711138f-b.text:
(1)
12th Street (formerly Troy Street), west from Eighth Avenue, at Abingdon Square. On the north side, the Jeffersonian Club, at 301-303 West 12th Street, is flying its flags. The six-story building on the S.W. corner of 12th and Hudson Streets, flying its flag, is Laura Spellman Hall Y. W. C. A.
May 30, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NEG # 3506

(2)
The same, but not showing No. 297 West 12th, which still stands, after demolition of Nos. 299-309. Nos. 6ll-6l9 Hudson Street,
on the west side, are thus disclosed.
September 21, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

711138f-a.text:
(1)
12th Street (formerly Troy Street), west from Eighth Avenue, at Abingdon Square. On the north side, the Jeffersonian Club, at 301-303 West 12th Street, is flying its flags. The six-story building on the S.W. corner of 12th and Hudson Streets, flying its flag, is Laura Spellman Hall Y. W. C. A.

710900f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue, west side, north from W. 12th to Jane Streets. At the left margin is a portion of a building that will be included in a new apartment house site. This is to be the towering No. 299 West 12th Street Building.
March 8, 1929
P. L. Sperr

710062f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue, north from W. 12th Street. View 2 is the same area several years later, showing in addition at 14th Street, the County Trust Company Building under construction.
October 1, 1928
Winter 1930
P. L. Sperr
402/D4  Neg #519

710062f-b.text:
Eighth Avenue, north from W. 12th Street. View 2 is the same area several years later, showing in addition at 14th Street, the County Trust Company Building under construction.
October 1, 1928
Winter 1930
P. L. Sperr
402/D4  Neg #519

711147f-b.text:
299 West 12th Street, north side of Abingdon Square, between Eighth Avenue and Hudson Street, under construction, seen
across Abingdon Square Park.
February 6, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
1UNE  A0N3607
(2)
The same, two years later.
March 12, 1933.
L. Sperr.

711147f-a.text:
299 West 12th Street, north side of Abingdon Square, between Eighth Avenue and Hudson Street, under construction, seen
across Abingdon Square Park.
February 6, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
1UNE  A0N3607
(2)
The same, two years later.
March 12, 1933.
L. Sperr.

710063f-b.text:
Eighth Avenue, north from W. 12th Street. The dominant County Trust Company Building is in its final stage. Trust Co. building is at the N. E. corner of 14th Street. W.12th Street is on the right. The view on the north side of same extends eastward to W. 14th Street. This forms the base of a triangular block. Note the Bing and Bing sign at the margin, announcing the proposed construction of a tall apartment house at the S. E. corner. This new structure, No. 20 Abingdon Square, appears
partially in the later view.
View 1: May 27, 1930
View 2: March 9, 1933
P. L. Sperr

710899f-a.text:
33-43 Eighth Avenue, west side, between Jane and 4th Streets.
March 16, 1933.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.

710899f-b.text:
33-43 Eighth Avenue, west side, between Jane and 4th Streets.
March 16, 1933.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.

711157f-a.text:
West 12th Street, north side, from Eighth Avenue (right) to Hudson Street (left), showing,across Abingdon Square, the 20 story apartment house, No. 299 West 12th Street. This massive building occupies the major portion of this frontage, excluding the small corner plot at the right. It was completed in June of 1931. Protruding beyond is the Port Authority Bldg. The photographers vantage point is at Bank Street.
May 12, 1940
P. L. Sperr

710058f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue at S. E. corner of 12th Street. 302 W 12 St, a 19 storey Bing and Bing apartment building. Sister building of 299 W 12 St, across Abingdon Square.
May 27, 1931.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.
